title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 4 units of Good H and 4 slices of pizza will maximize Zeynep’s total benefit given her weekly income of $12 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good H (6) is equal to the marginal benefit to the price of slices of pizza (6), or

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate consumer surplus as $11 and/or does not show the work.

Consumer Surplus = Marginal Benefit−Price =   $12−1 = $11 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aaboeacaqGVbGaaeOBaiaabohacaqG1bGaaeyBaiaabwgacaqGYbGa aeiiaiaabofacaqG1bGaaeOCaiaabchacaqGSbGaaeyDaiaabohaca qGGaGaaeypaiaabccacaqGnbGaaeyyaiaabkhacaqGNbGaaeyAaiaa b6gacaqGHbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGcbGaaeyzaiaab6gacaqGLbGaae OzaiaabMgacaqG0bGaeyOeI0IaciiuaiaackhacaqGPbGaae4yaiaa bwgacaqGGaGaaeypaiaabccacaqGGaGaaeiiaiaabscacaqGXaGaae OmaiabgkHiTiaaigdacaqGGaGaaeypaiaabccacaqGKaGaaeymaiaa bgdaaaa@6881@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Zeynep would not be able to buy 5 units of Good H and 3 slices of pizza and/or does not explain that her total expenditures would be $13 (=$2×5+$1×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaiikaiabg2da9iaacscacaaIYaGaey41aqRaaGyn aiabgUcaRiaacscacaaIXaGaey41aqRaaG4maiaacMcaaaa@43CC@ , which is greater than her weekly income of $10.

The response states that no, Zeynep would not be able to buy 5 units of Good H and 3 slices of pizza and explains that her total expenditures would be $13 (=$2×5+$1×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbbjxAHX garmWu51MyVXgaruWqVvNCPvMCG4uz3bqefqvATv2CG4uz3bIuV1wy Ubqee0evGueE0jxyaibaieYlf9irVeeu0dXdh9vqqj=hEeeu0xXdbb a9frFj0=OqFfea0dXdd9vqaq=JfrVkFHe9pgea0dXdar=Jb9hs0dXd bPYxe9vr0=vr0=vqpWqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaabauaaaOqaaa baaaaaaaaapeGaaiikaiabg2da9iaacscacaaIYaGaey41aqRaaGyn aiabgUcaRiaacscacaaIXaGaey41aqRaaG4maiaacMcaaaa@43CC@ , which is greater than her weekly income of $10.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the number of slices of pizza that will maximize Zeynep’s total benefit will decrease and/or does not explain that an increase in the price of an input to production will decrease the supply of pizza, which will increase the price of pizza, and an increase in the price of pizza would increase the total cost of pizza purchased while the total benefit remains the same.

The response states that the number of slices of pizza that will maximize Zeynep’s total benefit will decrease and explains that an increase in the price of an input to production will decrease the supply of pizza, which will increase the price of pizza, and an increase in the price of pizza would increase the total cost of pizza purchased while the total benefit remains the same.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify Good H and Good Z as substitutes and/or does not explain that the cross-price elasticity of demand is positive because a 3% decrease in the price of Good H led to a 2% decrease in the demand for Good Z.

The response identifies Good H and Good Z as substitutes and explains that the cross-price elasticity of demand is positive because a 3% decrease in the price of Good H led to a 2% decrease in the demand for Good Z.
